work.summary:
Working in the Parallel Processing department in the team that developed the Xaphir/Xilopix search engine's core. Orchestrated the integration of a dozen libraries developed at the company into a single unified image several times per month.
Developed from scratch a distributed computing framework. Bootstrapped and supervised the development of a distributed web crawler/scraper. Both software were used in the search engine's indexing chain to index millions of web pages per day.
The computing framework allowed to build complex and dynamic pipelines to distribute and perform various kind of computation tasks. A module system was created to quickly develop and deploy new components as well as their resources (ML models, ...). It was possible to setup different priority policies to handle jobs during their processing.
highlights: Technologies: Ruby, Python, RabbitMQ, MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch, Docker, Neural networks, Protobuf, REST, Test Units, Continuous integration, Automation, Code review, Gerrit, Jenkins

Integrated the Kadeploy3 REST API in the Grid'5000 one. Created and maintained Puppet recipes used to install and configure the services of the infrastructure. Developed scripts and tools for the users of the platform. Day by day administration, user support, issue resolution, supervision, automation.
highlights: Technologies: Ruby, Puppet, Xen/KVM/libvirt, Debian packaging, Rubygems

work.summary:
Worked on the Kadeploy3 software in a team that deals with High Performance Computing and in collaboration with the Grid'5000 (www.grid5000.fr) administration team.
Improved and maintained the software that is used in production on the Grid'5000 platform. Refactored the core's deployment automata that allows to deploy nodes following customisable and fail-tolerant workflows. Create a REST API to replace the RPC one. Add new features such as the support of new type of filesystem images and new ways to perform PXE netboots. Benchmarked the software, deployed 4000 VMs dispatched on 600+ physical machines localised on 5 different sites using a single Kadeploy3 service and TFTP server.
highlights: Technologies: Ruby, MySQL, REST, PXE netboot, Qemu/KVM, Gerrit, Jenkins, Test units, Blackbox tests, Automation

work.position: Junior Software Engineer - High Performance Computing
work.summary: Worked within a High Performance Computing research team. Developed from scratch the Distem software which is using GNU/Linux core features (such as control groups and namespaces) to shape LXC containers matching specific needs in terms of CPU, memory, network bandwidth/latency, etc. . Used complex Linux tc filters to reshape network capabilities of the containers. Implemented several CPU burning algorithms to emulate user-specified CPU frequencies. Designed a REST API to control the service.
highlights: Technologies: Ruby, Sinatra, C, LXC, cgroups, Linux Kernel, tc, cpufreq

projects.name: Kadeploy3

Deploying systems on hundreds of nodes in a few minutes without any intervention of the system administrator. It plays a key role on the Grid'5000 testbed, where it allows users to reconfigure the software environment of the nodes.

projects.name: Distem

The infrastructure of Grid'5000 is geographically distributed on different sites hosting the instrument (10 in 2011). It is composed of more than one thousand machines dispatched on about 30 clusters.
